decks.notes: The main focus of this Aggro-Maverick Legacy deck is to aggressively deploy disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Knight of the Reliquary while utilizing powerful tutor effects like Green Sun's Zenith to search for key cards. The deck also includes interaction spells like Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay to handle opponent threats. Additionally, the deck has a land combo package with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token for a quick win condition. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent while applying pressure with efficient creatures and land synergies.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo, which allows you to mill your opponent's entire library and win the game. The deck includes various artifacts and creatures to support this combo, along with disruption spells like Pyroblast and Swords to Plowshares to control the game. Additionally, the deck utilizes Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer to find and recur important pieces of the combo. Overall, the deck aims to quickly set up its combo win condition while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on assembling the Cloudpost mana base to quickly ramp into big threats like Emrakul and Ulamog. The key strategy is to use cards like Crop Rotation and Karn, the Great Creator to search for the necessary lands and artifacts to power out huge Eldrazi creatures. The deck also includes disruption like Disruptor Flute and Vexing Bauble to control the board while setting up the combo. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and mana acceleration.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a wide array of powerful cards to disrupt opponents' strategies and maintain board control. It includes a mix of removal spells, counter magic, card draw, and powerful creatures to outvalue opponents. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents. The deck also utilizes a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana fixing and access to key colors. Ultimately, the goal is to outlast opponents and grind out a victory through incremental advantage.

The main concept of this Dimir Aggro deck is to leverage powerful reanimation spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate to quickly bring back key creatures from the graveyard, such as Grief and Troll of Khazad-dûm. The deck also includes disruption spells like Daze and Force of Will to control the game while using cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for answers and set up combos. Aggressive creatures like Nethergoyf and Brazen Borrower along with removal spells like Fatal Push help maintain pressure on the opponent while overwhelming them with efficient threats.

The main concept of this deck is to generate infinite mana and use powerful artifacts like Mystic Forge and Paradox Engine to manipulate the top of the library and cast Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or other powerful spells for free. The deck focuses on assembling key artifact pieces such as Basalt Monolith, Grim Monolith, and Manifold Key to create a powerful combo engine. Karn, the Great Creator acts as a versatile toolbox to search for important artifacts, while Urza's Saga provides additional utility and synergy with the artifact-based strategy.

This combo deck relies on quickly filling the graveyard with Reanimate targets, using cards like Entomb and Balustrade Spy to mill the library, and then utilizing cards like Dread Return and Undercity Informer to quickly win the game. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Cabal Therapy and Pact of Negation to ensure the combo goes off successfully. By utilizing a combination of fast mana acceleration and powerful combo pieces, this deck aims to win the game in just a few turns.

This deck focuses on using small, efficient creatures and powerful spells to apply pressure and control the game. It utilizes cards like Brainstorm and Force of Will for card advantage and protection, while also including powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Primeval Titan. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption, utilizing a diverse mana base to ensure consistency in casting its powerful spells.

This Grixis Aggro deck utilizes efficient one-drop creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure early in the game. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats and control the board. The inclusion of Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog provides additional threats and card advantage, while cards like Ponder and Brainstorm help smooth out draws and find key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to quickly deploy threats, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and maintain tempo throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence and disrupting the opponent through mana denial and efficient beatdown creatures. By using cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide for fast mana, alongside powerful threats like Magus of the Moon and Minsc & Boo, the deck aims to apply pressure early and prevent the opponent from developing their own game plan. Additionally, cards like Chalice of the Void help to lock out the opponent's spells, while cards like Fury provide removal and reach. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan while maximizing consistency.

This deck focuses on using lands as resources to control the game. It utilizes cards like Crop Rotation and Exploration to quickly find and play powerful lands like Dark Depths and Urza's Saga. The deck also includes cards like Life from the Loam and Crucible of Worlds to repeatedly play lands from the graveyard. By controlling the board with cards like Wasteland and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponent using its land-based strategy.
